{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3564835,"name":"Sam","username":"Paraduks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/ea5d25/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-21T19:10:50.422Z","cooked":"

We have spent time tuning a three-piece auto for the left side of the reef. We use pathplanner. We would like to find a way to automatically create mirrored paths for the right side of the reef, so we don‚Äôt have to tune the poses for that side as well. We could work out the transform math for each target pose manually, but we would like a faster solution. What do other teams do? Is there a PathPlannerLib solution? Thanks for any help you can give.

You can use the mirrorPath() function:

pathplanner.dev

PathPlannerPath (pathplannerlib API)

declaration: package: com.pathplanner.lib.path, class: PathPlannerPath

This does make it possible, but as far as I can tell this would mean I have to assemble the autos manually in code, rather than in the pathplanner gui. Is there a way I could generate the mirrors for every path and save them as files? Or a way to deconstruct a Pathplanner auto in code, so I could flip all the paths and then add the composed command to our AutoChooser?

You might need to look into the class files but it seems like, at least in the java library, you can tell it whether or not to mirror the path when you initialize the auto!

image2138√ó438 37.1 KB
